definition: to get along well (with sb)/congenial/to speculate (on financial markets)
to cast/to send/to throw oneself (into the river etc)/to seek refuge/to place oneself into the hands of
to carve/carved words/to agree/a contract/a deed

sentences.english: I thellonk we two really click.
sentences.chinese: 我感覺咱們兩個蠻投契的。

sentences.english: On the other side compartments, Jenny and practicing very congenial, feel capable of deja vu.
sentences.chinese: 另邊廂，珍妮與力行非常投契，感覺得力行似曾相識。

sentences.english: Easily meet your opposite sex, so enjoy your courtship.
sentences.chinese: 身邊不斷會有異性出現，滿面春風，與異性十分投契。

sentences.english: E. g. The two boys hit it off only minutes after they have met.
sentences.chinese: 這兩個男孩只見面了幾分鐘就很投契。

sentences.english: The most difficult task in speculation is not prediction but self-control.
sentences.chinese: 正在投契裏最易的使命沒有非預測，而非自人節制。

definition: to be kindred spirits/to hit it off
to be able to talk to/to get along with/to be congenial
to share vile habits/partners in notoriety/birds of a feather
to have an affinity with each other (idiom)/to find each other congenial
to go well together/to be compatible/to cater to/to please
to get along well/compatible/also written 和得來|和得来[he2 de5 lai2]
to give one's bare heart into sb else's keeping (idiom); sb has one's absolute confidence/to trust completely/to confide in sb with entire sincerity
